reviews.title: Lovely hotel in good location

reviews.title: A fantastic stay in the APEX!!!!
reviews.text: When I booked this hotel, it was #1 on tripadvisor...not sure why it's dropped to #6! This hotel is mainly suited for the business traveler which is why it's located in the business district. My husband and I went to London for a weekend getaway, and loved the hotel. We stayed in a basic room for around 90 pounds per night. The room itself was small, but the bed was a King, and we had room to walk around. There is a flat screen t.v. on the wall with a dvd player, but remember it only plays the UK region. We happened to have a U.S. movie and it didn't work. The bathroom is HUGE for European standards. What impressed me the most (and I know this is probably insignificant to most readers) is that they had shampoo AND conditioner! All other countries only give you shampoo, which is frustrating when you don't want to pack your own products for weekend trips. The design of the room is incredibly nice for the price and this hotel could probably charge a lot more and still get as many reservations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: This gem of a hotel in The City is one of London's pleasant surprises. In a city more often known for tiny hotel rooms and non-working lifts, this modern, well-appointed hotel is a breath of fresh air. Service is slick, rooms have everything you need and the design details makes this hotel feel classy. It is a stone's throw away from Tower Hill station and Fenchurch Station. I love staying here on a weekend when it feels like one has The City to oneself.
reviews.title: A London favourite

reviews.title: Great hotel helped by friendly staff
Nice hotel, great location...staff needs some work
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location. Almost right across the street from the Tower of London and the London Bridge. Talk about a view! The hotel was nice and the rooms were spacious for London, but the staff wasn't all that friendly. Besides for the staff we would stay there again just for the location! O yea...you also get a little rubber duck to take home!! its sooo cute!

reviews.title: Beware - Mice!!!
reviews.text: I booked this hotel purely on the basis of the rating I seen with TripAdvisor and when I arrived I thought - yes this is nice - rooms good size, facilities fine and location not too bad. This changed very quickly when I returned to the hotel on the first night (Friday) for a few drinks before retiring. A while after our first drink, my husband started to say something to me but stopped - to which I paid no heed until he realised a little later that two women beside us had seen what he was about to tell me about - mice - running freely around the bar area. We mentioned this to the bar and restaurant staff and their response was amazing. They were totally aware of it and were prepared to do nothing about it - one of them asked did we expect them to kill an animal. The girl dealing with the restaurant was extremely rude saying that as long as it wasn't rats she didn't care. When I pointed out that the mice could run around glasses, pourers on the bottles, nuts that were being given out she just said there were no mice in the kitchens which I told her I didn't believe. We watched the mice come in and out through a gap in the internal walls so I can only imagine that they are in other places throughout the hotel. The duty manager eventually came over and tried to diffuse the issue but we just left after a heated discussion as he maintained he didn't know the mice were there even though the bar and restaurant staff were fully aware of it - I don't think so. As we seen three in the space of an hour, I'd imagine theres quite a few more in their comfortable little breeding ground.

reviews.title: Second time at the Apex City and still just as good
reviews.text: The next morning, we recieved a very small box of sweets - as in the size of a box of cards - as an apology - didn't go too far at making us feel like we wanted to stay in the hotel as all I could think of was what if they're in the air conditioning system and one of them joins me in bed! Also when we went down to go out for our breakfast - was I glad I had room only or what! - the breakfast was being served in the bar area where the mice had free reign the previous night.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: Apart from that the hotel itself would have been fine - and the concierge was very nice and helpful but I will not be going back there again - kinda took alot of the good of a rare weekend away from the kids.

reviews.title: Fantastic capital hotel
reviews.text: Second time we have stayed at this hotel for a weekend break. The rooms are excellent - and the price is very good value for a stay in London (there are reduced rates for the weekend).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Apex City Of London hotel for a long weekend in December. It was easy to get to on the underground from Victoria Station, with hotel only 5 minutes walk from Tower Hill underground station.The room was clean, tidy and modern with nice facilities and a bath and large shower.There was a nice bar area, but the hotel is close to a number of pubs and restaurants as well.There is good shopping close by and you are within walking distance of Petticoat Lane Market and Spittlefields Market. However it is the Tower Of London which is right on the doorstep that is the most impressive thing, with great view of the Thames and Tower Bridge.
reviews.title: Great time at the Apex

reviews.text: The staff at the Apex were friendly and all in all it was a very reasonably priced weekend.We would definately return next time we are in London.

reviews.title: Great escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Early check in at 11.00 am was possible with an upgraded room but not on a high floor, so we waited a bit and 1 hour later we were given free of charge a superior room on the last floor. Lovely view on the Thames and the monuments like Tower Bridge from a small private terrace. Spotless bathroom with bathtube and shower. But the most important to highlight is the great attention and care received from the reception staff who were friendly, helpful, courteous and smiling. We want to thank in particular Fabian, Pei Wei and Stefano. They help us booking our dinner and NYE party. They searched information about exhibitions at the National gallery. They took time to discuss with us and always find a solution to any little problems or queries we could experience. They have made our stay in London be extraordinarily pleasant!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: For all these reasons, I would recommend you to book this hotel for your next trip to London, it is an excellent 1st choice for 2012!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: We dined in the restaurant for both dinner and breakfast and the food was excellent - in-house burger for me and seafood pasta for my wife were both brilliant (not a hint of microwaving!). Breakfast was also excellent with any hot food cooked to order - not under hot plates - and an excellent variety of all other international breakfast foods on offer (cold meats, fruits, yoghurts and so on). My only slight concern was the waiter/restaurant manager being a touch too enthusiastic at dinner, clanging our table water bottle onto our glasses a couple of times! This is splitting the minutest of hairs thought.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Apex hotel of London over Christmas. The room was spacious, clean, and modern. Free in-room internet access was great! Bathroom had separate shower and tub and lots of great shower amenities. Even have speaker connected to TV so you can listen while you bath. Staff was friendly and helpful. Few steps from Tower of London and Metro (tower hills). Quiet rooms. Not too many restaurants in the area, but being so close to Metro, we took it straight to Covent Garden and had everything within reach. Nothing to complain about. Price was very reasonable. Definitely recommend!!! =)

description: Located in the city, close to Tower Bridge, this contemporary four star deluxe hotel has 179 stylish en-suite rooms. Designed for comfort, the rooms include widescreen TV, large desk, Free Wi-Fi internet access and local calls, ground coffee and selected teas, specially blended toiletries, iron and ironing board. The stylish bathrooms offer bath with separate walk-in power showers. Hotel facilities include Addendum Bar and Restaurant, Event space for up to 70 delegates and Gym.
